result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Kirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K Kirk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian K Kirk in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5
days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with Hot Spot Liquors.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

****Court approved participation in Dosage Probation Pilot Program and early termination of probation if defendant successfully completes program and all other conditions of probation.  Card provided to defendant.

Appeal rights given.  Court DENIED defense request for expungement.

The remaining balance of the bail shall be returned to the remitter. 
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, and to follow all the conditions of bail. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea in Branch 26 on 05-28-2014 at 08:30 am.

COURT PROCEEDED WITHOUT A FILE.
Defendant Brian K Kirk in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM023551  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-01-14

Court ordered bail set for $300.00; TOT once again to Justice Point; ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; no alcohol or drugs; no firearms or weapons.   Court ordered case continued before Branch 26 on 5/28/14 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Brian K Kirk in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Entry made without file.  Branch 20 for Branch 26.  Defendant tested positive for THC.  First denied use, but then admitted to using.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court ordered $300.00 cash.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Brian K Kirk in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-28-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian K Kirk in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Brian K Kirk in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Brian K Kirk in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
